description:
Goku Son is a young boy who lives in the woods all alone—that is until a girl named Bulma runs into him in her search for a set of magical objects called the "Dragon Balls." Since the artifacts are said to grant one wish to whoever collects all seven, Bulma hopes to gather them and wish for a perfect boyfriend. Goku happens to be in possession of a dragon ball, but unfortunately for Bulma, he refuses to part ways with it, so she makes him a deal: he can tag along on her journey if he lets her borrow the dragon ball's power. With that, the two set off on the journey of a lifetime.

They don't go on the journey alone. On the way, they meet the old Muten-Roshi and wannabe disciple Kuririn, with whom Goku trains to become a stronger martial artist for the upcoming World Martial Arts Tournament. However, it's not all fun and games; the ability to make any wish come true is a powerful one, and there are others who would do much worse than just wishing for a boyfriend. To stop those who would try to abuse the legendary power, they train to become stronger fighters, using their newfound strength to help the people around them along the way.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)
synonyms: ดราก้อนบอล

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Martial Arts
tags.description: Centers around the use of traditional hand-to-hand combat.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Orphan
tags.description: Prominently features a character that is an orphan.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Aliens
tags.description: Prominently features extraterrestrial lifeforms.

tags.name: Wuxia
tags.description: Chinese fiction concerning the adventures of martial artists in Ancient China.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Military
tags.description: Centered around the life and activities of military personnel.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Time Skip
tags.description: Features a gap in time used to advance the story.

tags.name: Dinosaurs
tags.description: Prominently features Dinosaurs, prehistoric reptiles that went extinct millions of years ago.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Demons
tags.description: Prominently features malevolent otherworldly creatures.

tags.name: Shapeshifting
tags.description: Features character(s) who changes one's appearance or form.

tags.name: Adoption
tags.description: Features a character who has been adopted by someone who is neither of their biological parents.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: Ninja
tags.description: Prominently features Japanese warriors traditionally trained in espionage, sabotage and assasination.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

node.description:
__Cousin:__ [Aaron Dismuke](https://anilist.co/staff/95254/Aaron-Dismuke)

__Justin Ryan Cook__ is an American voice actor, producer, line producer, ADR director and enginner who works for FUNimation.

He debuted in 1979 with the story [Wonder Island](https://anilist.co/manga/112596/Wonder-Island/), published in Weekly Shounen Jump, and first gained popularity for the anime and manga series [Dr. Slump](https://anilist.co/manga/30796/Dr-Slump/), originally serialized weekly in Shounen Jump from 1980 to 1984. In 1982, he won the Shogakukan Manga Award for Dr. Slump for best shounen or shoujo manga series of the year.  In 1984, Toriyama was responsible for developing [Dragon Ball](https://anilist.co/manga/30042/Dragon-Ball/) which was initially serialized in Weekly Shōnen Jump. It became an instant accomplishment—primarily selling over 35,000,000 copies in Japan, Dragon Ball eventually became a record-breaking best seller with over 120,000,000 copies sold. Aside from the Japanese fame, the series was equally successful internationally as well, including in Europe (1988), Canada (1996) and Latin America. Its success encouraged Toriyama to continue working on Dragon Ball from 1984 to 1995. During that eleven-year period, he produced 519 chapters, collected into 42 volumes. Each volume has an average of 200 pages. Moreover, the benefit of the manga led to three anime adaptations, numerous feature-length animated movies, several video games, and mega-merchandising. Toriyama's studio is called "Bird Studio", which is a play on his name, "tori" meaning "bird."

Toriyama married his wife [Yoshimi Kato](https://anilist.co/staff/311142/Nachi-Mikami) on May 2, 1982. She is a former manga artist from Nagoya under the pen name "Nachi Mikami" and occasionally helped Toriyama and his assistant on Dr. Slump when they were short on time. Together with his wife, he had two children: a son born in 1987, and a daughter born in 1990. He was a well-known recluse, who avoided appearing in public or media.

On March 8, 2024, it was announced that Toriyama passed away at the age of 68 from acute subdural hematoma.

The founder and former representative director of [Funimation](https://anilist.co/studio/102/).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Policeman in "Chuck E. Cheese in the Galaxy 5000"

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/中鶴勝祥)

Originating from [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/). Most known for his work in the [Digimon](https://anilist.co/anime/552/) franchise.
Barry Watson is president and CEO of Illumitoon Entertainment. He was formerly a producer and voice director for FUNimation Entertainment.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/75655903) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/something_Yoshimatsu/)

Affiliated with Studio Live since 1982. Studied under [Toyoo Ashida](https://anilist.co/staff/110953/). He has deep ties into [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) ever since working as a character designer on [Trigun](https://anilist.co/anime/6/) in 1998. A member of the Japanese Animation Creators Association (JAniCA).

Works as a mangaka under the name Something Yoshimatsu (サムシング吉松).

Stared his career at [Studio Live](https://anilist.co/studio/6460/Studio-Live). One of the founding members of [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/PA-Works), he is currently Head of the Animation Department at the studio. He became close with [Kenji Kamiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/100348/Kenji-Kamiyama) while working on The Hakkenden, with the two working together on [Ghost in the Shell: Stand Alone Complex](https://anilist.co/anime/467/Ghost-in-the-Shell-Stand-Alone-Complex/) where Yoshihara directed the episodes outsourced to P.A. Works. He had his debut as Director with [The Eccentric Family](https://anilist.co/anime/17909/The-Eccentric-Family/).
